page.title: 16LOCAL HISTORY Clipston 1900
page.content: Mr. Wilford a local character, was able to give us a very clear idea about what life was like at the turn of the century. Every one in the village knew everyone else. There was virtually no transport out, only the horse and cart for the richer members of the community. The majority of the people were born, lived their childhood, married a local person, raised their own family and died all within the village itself. At this time Clipston had its own railway station but it was two miles from the village and too expensive to use on a regular basis. The local taxi was a pony and trap, the only other alternatives to these methods of transport was either walking, cycling or getting a lift on the Brewers Dray.
